definition: novel of denunciation (according to Lu Xun's 鲁迅 classification)

sentences.english: Sooner or later, you'llget your conscience smitten.
sentences.chinese: 總有一天，你會受到良心譴責的。

sentences.english: He keeps his head down as his mother blames him.
sentences.chinese: 他母親譴責他時，他始終低着頭。

sentences.english: We furiously exclaimed upon the wickedness of the plot they conspired against our company.
sentences.chinese: 我們憤怒譴責他們對我們公司策劃的陰謀。

sentences.english: Anakin accused Padmé of betraying him, and used the Force the strangle her.
sentences.chinese: 阿納金譴責帕德梅背叛他，並用原力掐她。

sentences.english: I thought that is really reprehensible.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得這是應該譴責的。

sentences.english: The UnitedStates and Great Britain condemned the disclosure.
sentences.chinese: 美國與英國譴責了本次公佈行爲。

sentences.english: "If you never condemned, you would never need to forgive".
sentences.chinese: 如果你從不譴責，你就絕不需要寬恕。

sentences.english: The writer to Ephesians condemns that kind of language.
sentences.chinese: 《以弗所書》的作者譴責這種語言。

sentences.english: The United States strongly condemns the act of aggression that led to their deaths.
sentences.chinese: 美國強烈譴責導致這些水兵喪生的侵略行徑。

sentences.english: He upbraided her with her ingratitude.

sentences.chinese: 這種譴責是不值一顧的。

sentences.english: He denounced the missile launch as provocative but made no sudden moves.
sentences.chinese: 他譴責導彈發射是種挑釁，但是並沒有採取突然行動。

sentences.english: Reprimanding your puppy will not stop him from biting.
sentences.chinese: 譴責你的小狗，會不會停止他的咬噬。

sentences.english: Anson Chan decried the comments by Tsang as a "provocation and personal attack".
sentences.chinese: 陳方安生譴責曾德成的言論是挑釁及人身攻擊。

sentences.english: Most who unveil hisagendas deserve the condemnation they receive。
sentences.chinese: 大多數人，祕密計劃敗露了，得到應有的譴責。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
